relevant_findings.mental_status: Oriented but confused by instructions, recalled 1 of 3 objects at three minutes.
relevant_findings.gait: Minimally ataxic, right leg swinging out slightly.

relevant_findings.general_examination: Diminished right dorsalis pedis and posterior tibial pulses.
relevant_findings.upper_extremity_strength: 4+/5 bilaterally in finger extensors, 4/5 at hip flexors, 5/5 in other muscle groups.
relevant_findings.gait: Walked slowly and unsteadily, small steps on a narrow base, tandem walking resulted in falls.

relevant_findings.articulation: Improved articulation but speech remained slow, suggesting left-sided weakness of the tongue.
relevant_findings.gait: Improvement in walking and balance noted after physical therapy.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially increased weakness and instability, later reported improvement with therapy.

relevant_findings.hand_function: Mild atrophy of intrinsic muscles of both hands, hypereactive deep tendon reflexes, and bilateral Babinski signs present.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Fasciculations developed six weeks after discharge, and atrophy became visible in upper and lower extremities.
